plugins.name: BableBox
plugins.description:
BableBox is a Figma plugin designed to make translating your interfaces a breeze. With a single click, it converts your entire design from one language to another, preserving context to ensure accurate, natural translations.


Say goodbye to the hassle of translating hundreds of words and phrases manually! BableBox leverages GPT-4o mini, one of the best AI models, which understands the context of each text to avoid errors (it intelligently skips icons and symbols like FontAwesome, for instance).


This plugin is perfect for designers and global teams looking for a fast, reliable, and easy solution to translate projects while maintaining content coherence and quality.


In short: a one-click translation tool built to save you time and reduce errors. üåçüöÄ
plugins.tagline: BableBox: Translate your designs in one click, with perfect context üåç

plugins.name: JSONify
plugins.description:
Export Text Layers as JSON


JSONify simplifies your workflow by automatically converting selected text layers into structured JSON data.


In JSONify, each Figma layer‚Äôs name becomes a key in the exported JSON, and the text content within the layer becomes its corresponding value.


For example, a layer named "title" containing the text "Hello World!" would generate the following JSON entry:

"title": "Hello World! (classic üòâ)"


This straightforward mapping keeps your exported JSON organized, clean, and easy to integrate - directly reflecting the structure of your design.


How the Plugin Works


  1. Layer names = Object keys: Each layer name becomes a key in the exported JSON object.
  2. Line breaks = Array items: Text containing line breaks (\n) is split into an array of strings.
  3. Groups = Arrays: Grouped text layers are exported as array items under the group's name.
  4. Prefix ‚Äúexclude-‚Äù to skip: Any layer whose name starts with exclude- will be excluded from the export.


üñ§ Open-source & community-driven! Check out the code or contribute: https://github.com/ko-ko-lo/figma-json-export


üí¨ Feedback, ideas, or just want to say hi? Drop a comment - I‚Äôd love to hear from you!

accepted.name: Denise Kolodzey
accepted.description:
üëã Hi! 
I‚Äôm a UX Engineer with a love for thoughtful tools and beautiful details.
I build Figma plugins that make workflows smoother and design more fun.

plugins.name: Juxync
plugins.description:
Want to get alpha access to Jux? Visit jux.io


Jux is a code-based canvas design tool that plugs right into developer's codebase, enabling product designers to design the UI itself and developers its logic.

Creating a good color tokens system is a complex task. Use Juxync to import your variables to Jux to use as design tokens. Juxync will convert your variables collections, groups and modes into token sets to use in Jux. It will maintain all the relationships between variables.


How does Juxync work?

For more visual ‚Äòhow does it work‚Äò, visit the knowledge base

  1. It scans Figma color variables in your chosen file.
  2. The plugin auto maps the tokens into core, and other semantics sets.
  3. Sync the tokens into the Jux token management, allowing developers to view and use these tokens via our CLI.


Next up: (or Future features)

  1. Sync Assets (SVG)
  2. Dimensions tokens
  3. Typography styles
  4. Check out the roadmap for more information


Want to be among the first to join the alpha? Join our community

accepted.name: Jux
accepted.description: We‚Äôre building a code-based design tool so designers can design the actual, real product as it will be used in production.

plugins.tagline: Juxync imports your Figma Variables as design tokens to Jux, seamlessly.

plugins.name: FontFig
plugins.description:
ü§î How it works:


  1. 1. Choose a font. This will be your base font - it can either be a font you want to manipulate or just help you get a good foundation for the different characters
  2. 2. Import the font. Fontfig will generate an artboard for every character and convert every character into an SVG.
  3. 3. Get creative. Manipulate or create totally new characters.
  4. 4. Export your new font (Whoop)


üëâ Pointers:


  1. üìÑ One Font can be created / edited per page
  2. üíæ Export each font up to 5 times for one price.
  3. üìê Adjust the width of the artboard to change letter spacing for each character
  4. üí™ Support for more complex fonts coming soon


üí¨ We need your feedback:


  1. Drop us a comment or message if you see anything you think could be better. We want to continually improve this Plugin so your feedback is super helpful!
plugins.tagline: Create your own fonts in Figma

plugins.name: Scout : Your Design System Auditor
plugins.description:
Scout: Your Design System Auditor

Ever felt like your design tokens are playing hide-and-seek? üïµÔ∏è‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è Meet Scout, your trusty design detective‚Äîready to sniff out sneaky inconsistencies and bring harmony back to your Figma universe!


Scout swiftly audits your Figma files, uncovering rogue color hexes and typography rebels that forgot their tokens at home. No more developer handoff blues or "Oops, missed that!" moments. üéØ


Superpowers:

Color Detective: Catches color chaos quicker than you can shout ‚ÄúHex!‚Äù


Typography Sleuth: Spots font fugitives and sizes that went astray, keeping your design tight.


Smart Suggestions: Suggests spot-on tokens and handy fallbacks instantly‚Äîbecause who doesn't love instant magic? ‚ú®


Theme-Agnostic: Works seamlessly with both light and dark themes, maintaining style consistency across all modes.


Local Variable & Style Support: Perfectly compatible with local variables and styles, ensuring complete design system integration.


Pinpoint Precision: Clearly tells you exactly where the issue is‚Äîno guessing games, just solutions!


How to Use Scout:


1. Feed Your Tokens: Connect Scout to your design system first‚Äîit'll securely save all your tokens locally.

2. Scan: Open Scout in any Figma file, select the frame you want to check, and hit "Scan."

3. Instant Results: Scout immediately highlights issues, suggests precise fixes, and ensures your designs stay token-perfect.


Scout is fun, quirky, and deadly accurate; a designer's best friend and a developer's dream come true. Let Scout do the heavy lifting and keep your designs perfectly polished. 


Get Scout today and give your design system the auditor it deserves.


Scout is currently in beta. Found bugs? Have questions, suggestions, or feature requests? üíå DM me on Twitter

accepted.name: Satyam
accepted.description: Product and UI/UX Designer | Email me at sat02yam@gmail.com

plugins.name: Node Exporter
plugins.description:
üß© Node Exporter


Node Exporter is a powerful Figma plugin that lets you extract full or partial JSON data from selected design nodes ‚Äî including all their children ‚Äî with just a click.


‚ú® Features


- üîç Inspect any selected nodes in your Figma file

- üßæ Export all node properties (deep scan via prototype chain)

- ‚úÖ Or choose specific common properties to extract (e.g., name, width, layoutMode)

- üå≥ Recursively includes children of selected nodes

- üíæ Outputs clean, downloadable `.json` files

- ‚ö°Ô∏è Fast, no setup, no code required


---


üöÄ How to Use


1. Install the plugin from Figma Community

2. Open your Figma or FigJam file

3. Select one or more nodes

4. Right-click ‚Üí Plugins ‚Üí Node Exporter

5. You'll see two options:

- `‚ú® Export All Properties`: grabs every readable property for all selected nodes and children

- `üîß Choose Properties to Export`: shows a checkbox list of common properties you can include

6. Click the relevant button and a `.json` file will automatically download!


---


üì¶ Example Use Cases


- Design-to-code workflows

- Creating component libraries

- Auditing design system properties

- JSON handoff for frontend developers

- Custom design analysis


---


üîê Permissions


Node Exporter does not require any network access or authentication. All processing is done locally in your editor.


---


üß† Tech Notes


- Uses JavaScript reflection to walk the prototype chain

- Safe error handling (non-serializable properties skipped)

- Deep export support for nested `children` arrays


---


üë®‚Äçüíª Developer Info


Created by Agent Null

Have ideas, feedback or bugs? Open an issue or contribute!
plugins.tagline: Extract all or selected node properties as JSON, including children ‚Äî quick, clean, and magical!

Instantly flip any text layer‚Äîor whole frames‚Äîfrom Latin to Serbian Cyrillic and back.

‚Ä¢ Select text, groups, frames, or the entire page

‚Ä¢ Run Plugins ‚Üí ‚ÄúLatin ‚ûú Cyrillic‚Äù or ‚ÄúCyrillic ‚ûú Latin‚Äù

‚Ä¢ Fonts auto‚Äëload, characters swap, you‚Äôre done


‚ú® Why it‚Äôs handy

‚Ä¢ Keeps typographic styles intact (font, size, color)

‚Ä¢ Handles digraphs (d≈æ, lj, nj, dj) correctly

‚Ä¢ Works inside components, variants, and instances

‚Ä¢ Zero setup, zero UI‚Äîpure speed


‚ö†Ô∏è Limitations

‚Ä¢ Only supports Serbian alphabet (no Russian/Belarusian rules yet)

‚Ä¢ Ignores mixed selections locked inside Boolean Ops

plugins.name: Structura ‚Äì Effortless Page Organization
plugins.description:
Effortlessly organize and standardize your Figma files with reusable page templates.


Structura helps teams and designers maintain consistency across projects by enabling the creation, saving, and application of structured page layouts. Whether you prefer using built-in presets or custom templates, Structura simplifies your workflow, ensuring every file is clear and organized.



‚ú® Key Features


  1. Create & Save Custom Templates ‚Äì Design your own page structures and reuse them effortlessly.
  2. Use Ready-Made Presets ‚Äì Get started instantly with professionally designed page layouts.
  3. One-Click Template Application ‚Äì Quickly apply a structure to any Figma file.
  4. Consistent File Organization ‚Äì Standardize file layouts for better team collaboration.
  5. Easy Editing & Updating ‚Äì Modify and update templates as your workflow evolves.



üöÄ How to Use


  1. Choose a Template ‚Äì Select from built-in presets or create your own.
  2. Apply to Your File ‚Äì Instantly structure your Figma pages with one click.
  3. Customize as Needed ‚Äì Edit sections or save new layouts for future use.
  4. Stay Organized ‚Äì Ensure every file follows a consistent and streamlined structure.
plugins.tagline: Effortlessly organize and standardize your Figma files with reusable page templates.

plugins.name: Text Styles from CSV
plugins.description:
**Text Styles from CSV** is a Figma plugin that allows users to import text styles directly from a CSV file, saving time and ensuring consistency across projects.


### ‚ú® Features:

- üìÇ Import text styles from a CSV file with one click.

- üî† Supports font family, weight, size, letter spacing, and line height.

- üé® Automatically creates text styles in Figma for easy reuse.

- ‚ö° Speeds up the design process by reducing manual styling.


### üìå How It Works:

1. Open the plugin in Figma.

2. Upload your CSV file containing text style definitions.

3. Click "Import" to instantly create and apply styles.


For more details, check the **[GitHub Repository](https://github.com/metagrati/text-styles-from-csv).**
plugins.tagline: Import text styles into Figma from a CSV file. Automate typography styles creation.

plugins.name: bb-extract
plugins.description: With our Figma plugin, easily export design tokens to JSON format and gain the added advantage of live values! The plugin extends the 'import & export variables' example, streamlining the process by excluding imports and introducing a 'calculatedValue' property with actual color values (e.g., #00F instead of {colors.blue}). Now, you can seamlessly integrate design tokens directly into your codebase, making it a breeze to maintain a consistent design system. Simplify your design workflow and boost collaboration with this powerful plugin today!
plugins.tagline: Enhance your design token workflow with live values! üí´

93017.description: With our Figma plugin, easily export design tokens to JSON format and gain the added advantage of live values! The plugin extends the 'import & export variables' example, streamlining the process by excluding imports and introducing a 'calculatedValue' property with actual color values (e.g., #00F instead of {colors.blue}). Now, you can seamlessly integrate design tokens directly into your codebase, making it a breeze to maintain a consistent design system. Simplify your design workflow and boost collaboration with this powerful plugin today!
93017.release_notes: Introduced a recursive check for local variables that reference other local variables, ensuring accurate calculation of values. This update resolves issues in previous versions where the target variable was located within a group inside a collection.
93017.tagline: Enhance your design token workflow with live values! üí´

plugins.name: Design-to-JSON
plugins.description:
Design to JSON: A Developer's Bridge


Supercharge your design-to-development workflow with Design to JSON. This plugin inspects your selected Figma layers and recursively exports the entire hierarchy into a clean, structured, and developer-friendly JSON format. Stop manually transcribing design specs and start automating your UI development.


Who Is It For?

This plugin is built primarily for Frontend Developers and UI Engineers who need to translate Figma designs into pixel-perfect code. It's also a powerful tool for Design System Maintainers and anyone looking to automate asset extraction or design analysis.


Key Features:

‚Ä¢Recursive Tree Traversal: It doesn't just scan the top layer. The plugin dives deep into all nested frames, groups, and components to give you a complete hierarchical view.

‚Ä¢Absolute Coordinates for Layout: Outputs the global coordinates and dimensions (absoluteRenderBounds) for every element, which is exactly what you need for CSS positioning, eliminating guesswork with relative positions.

‚Ä¢Comprehensive Property Extraction: Captures a wide range of properties crucial for development:

oGeometry: Position, size, rotation.

oStyling: Fills, strokes, and effects with RGBA color values (0-255).

oTypography: Font family, style, size, line height, letter spacing, and alignment.

oAuto Layout: Direction, padding, and item spacing.

oComponent Info: Details about instances and their main components.

‚Ä¢Simple & Clean UI: A straightforward interface to generate and copy the JSON with a single click.


How to Use:

1.Select one or more elements on your Figma canvas.

2.Run the "Design to JSON" plugin.

3.Click the "Generate JSON" button.

4.The JSON output will appear in the text area.

5.Click "Copy to Clipboard" to grab the data and use it in your code.


Best Practices for Your Design File:

To get the most accurate and useful JSON, it's recommended to follow these design practices:

‚Ä¢Name Your Layers: Use descriptive layer names (e.g., "SubmitButton" instead of "Rectangle 128"). These names appear directly in the JSON, making it much more readable.

‚Ä¢Embrace Auto Layout: The plugin is built to understand Auto Layout. Using it for components, buttons, and layouts will provide rich data (padding, spacing, direction) that is directly translatable to Flexbox or similar CSS models.

‚Ä¢Use Components: Structuring your design with components helps maintain a clean hierarchy, which will be reflected in the JSON output. The plugin captures instance information.

‚Ä¢Avoid Unnecessary Grouping: Whenever possible, use Frames with Auto Layout instead of nested groups (Group > Group > Element). This results in a cleaner and more semantic JSON structure.


Limitations & Caveats:

‚Ä¢Mixed Styles in Text: While the plugin recursively finds the properties of individual elements, if a single text node contains multiple styles (e.g., different fonts or colors applied to different words), the Figma API provides summary data. The plugin will note this but cannot separate the mixed styles within that single element.

‚Ä¢Complex Vector Data: This plugin focuses on properties relevant for UI layout and styling. It does not export the raw path data (<path d="...">) of complex vector networks or boolean operations.

‚Ä¢API Boundaries: The plugin can only extract data that is exposed by the official Figma Plugin API.


Support the Developer

This plugin is developed and maintained with love. If you find it useful and it saves you time, you can say thanks by supporting its future development. Every bit of support is hugely appreciated!

plugins.name: Syntax Manager
plugins.description:
Syntax Manager helps you efficiently organize and apply code syntax (Web, Android, iOS) to your Figma variables. Whether you're prepping for development or just keeping things tidy, it streamlines your syntax workflow.


Core Features

  1. Filter variables by syntax status: all, with syntax, or without
  2. Narrow results by variable library or specific folder
  3. Search by variable name or syntax label
  4. Clean table view displaying variable names and their assigned syntax (Web, Android, iOS)
  5. Inline syntax editing: click directly on the syntax to edit it on the spot
  6. Multiselect with quick Select/Deselect All
  7. Floating action bar to apply updates or remove syntax for selected or all variables
  8. Custom syntax input field with {value} dynamic placeholder support
  9. Prefix dropdown (Auto / Name / Syntax) to control how the template is applied
  10. Advanced find/replace patterns using > and multiple replacements separated by ; for flexible syntax modification


Key Benefits

  1. Saves time: Batch-edit syntax across multiple variables in seconds
  2. Reduces errors: See all syntax at a glance and avoid inconsistencies
  3. Flexible control: Customize syntax naming conventions with smart placeholders
  4. Streamlines handoff: Align design tokens with dev-ready syntax for every platform
  5. Scales effortlessly: Perfect for small projects or massive variable libraries


How to Use

  1. Choose your view: filter by syntax presence or focus on specific libraries/folders
  2. Search or scroll to find relevant variables
  3. Select variables manually or use Select All
  4. Click directly on any syntax cell to edit it inline, or use the footer bar to add, update, or remove syntax
  5. Enter a custom syntax name (or leave it blank to use the variable name) or use find>replace patterns or ; for multiple replacements to transform parts of variable names (for instructions click the (?) icon)
  6. Apply your changes ‚Äì done!
plugins.tagline: Syntax management for variables made effortless.

plugins.description:
Stop duplicating your work! Convert entire flows or single frames between iOS and Android in seconds ‚Äî no more tedious manual adjustments.


Why OS Converter?

Designers are often faced with a choice:

  1. Design in one OS and leave conversions to developers
  2. Manually recreate each flow for both platforms


With OS Converter, you get the best of both worlds ‚Äî fast, accurate, and hassle-free conversion.


How it works:

  1. Set up your components ‚Äì Use a variant property named "OS" with values "iOS" and "Android"
  2. Run the plugin ‚Äì When your layouts are ready to convert
  3. Click to swap! ‚Äì Convert single frames or entire flows in one click
  4. üé® See it in action! Check out the sample file below.

plugins.name: Pattern Blocks
plugins.description:
Unlock unlimited pattern creation with Patternblocks!


With access to hundreds of unique shapes, you can create an endless variety of patterns tailored to your needs. Easily control tiling and pattern variety to achieve the perfect design, whether you're creating backgrounds, UI elements, or other graphic assets.


Customize colors and shape selections to match your vision, and export your patterns in high-quality PNG or SVG vector formats for use in web, app, and product designs.
plugins.tagline: Create endless unique vector patterns with hundreds of shapes for web, app, and product UI designs.
